title: When launching 50 vms some of them fail to start vm_state=error task_state=networking.

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~davidnaori3

comments.content:
I think this maybe the main reason

Command: sudo nova-rootwrap guestmount --rw -a /var/lib/nova/instances/instance-000001b3/disk -m /dev/sda1 /tmp/tmp5TGt1N
Exit code: 1
Stdout: ''
Stderr: 'libguestfs: error: guestfs_launch failed, see earlier error messages\n' from (pid=2803) trycmd /usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/nova/utils.py:278
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jiyou09

comments.content:
I don't think it's due to libguestfs as --files are not specified, and so failure to inject other stuff is only a warning

The only occurances of ERROR in the compute log is multiple instances of the following messaging timeout.
I notice there are no ERRORs in network.log

2012-06-05 16:15:04 ERROR nova.rpc.amqp [req-350b4a03-ec81-4f65-abee-8cbc13f175d0 2f4edfa99cab42de92eacda360043116 7eed65dd55474b9e94cd412d9f66b406] Exception during message handling

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~p-draigbrady

comments.content: Could you give a bit more information on your setup ? Any reason why you'd hit those timeouts, like contention on rabbitMQ due to it running on the same host as compute node ? Looks like a "normal" case of start failure under excessive load. Did you try playing with config options like rpc_response_timeout ?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content: Does increasing rpc_response_timeout a bit let you workaround this issue ?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content: We cannot solve the issue you reported without more information. Could you please provide the requested information ?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content:
I've reproduced the issue using rpc_response_timeout defaukt value (60).
I'm running all compunents using a single host.
Version = Essex.

btw, when i start the VM's in groups of 5 at a time, the bug won't reproduce.
please let me know if there is any more information you need.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~nmagnezi

comments.content: My question is, if you raise the rpc_response_timeout value, does it work around the issue or not ?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content: It didn't work around the issue.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~nmagnezi

comments.content: This bug lacks the necessary information to effectively reproduce and fix it, therefore it has been closed. Feel free to reopen the bug by providing the requested information and set the bug status back to ''New''.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~dims-v

comments.content:
Just to shed some light, I've seen the very errors in our infrastructure, with a similar number of instances beign spawned (as far as I can remember we launched 50 instances in 50 compute nodes).

The timeout errors were solved by raising the rpc_response_timeout, so I think this is more a matter of configuration rather than a nova bug.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~aloga
